support_summary: ATXN3 interacts with EZH2, the catalytic subunit of the PRC2 complex, thereby modulating histone methylation and gene silencing.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 interacts with EZH2, the catalytic subunit of the PRC2 complex responsible for methylating histone H3 on lysine 27 (H3K27me3), a mark associated with transcriptional repression.
functions.effect_description: By interacting with EZH2, ATXN3 may influence the epigenetic landscape and gene expression by modulating the catalytic activity or targeting of the PRC2 complex.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 binds EZH2 -> Potential regulation of EZH2's methyltransferase activity -> Altered H3K27me3 levels at target genes -> Control of gene silencing

evidence.paper_title: EZH2-mediated H3K27 trimethylation mediates neurodegeneration in ataxia-telangiectasia

mechanism: ATXN3 interacts with EZH2, the catalytic subunit of the PRC2 complex responsible for methylating histone H3 on lysine 27 (H3K27me3), a mark associated with transcriptional repression.
effect: By interacting with EZH2, ATXN3 may influence the epigenetic landscape and gene expression by modulating the catalytic activity or targeting of the PRC2 complex.
summary: ATXN3 interacts with EZH2 to modulate histone h3k27 methylation.

evidence.paper_title: EZH2-mediated H3K27 trimethylation mediates neurodegeneration in ataxia-telangiectasia
